compounddef.innerclass: llama::CompareUID< T_DDA, T_BaseA, T_LocalA, T_DDB, T_BaseB, T_LocalB, typename std::enable_if<(T_LocalA::size !=T_LocalB::size) >::type >
llama::CompareUID< T_DDA, T_BaseA, T_LocalA, T_DDB, T_BaseB, T_LocalB, typename std::enable_if<(T_LocalA::size==0) &&(T_LocalB::size==0) >::type >

memberdef.type: boost::mp11::mp_repeat_c< DatumStruct< DatumElement< NoName, T_Child > >, T_count >
memberdef.definition: using llama::DatumArray = boost::mp11::mp_repeat_c< DatumStruct< DatumElement< NoName, T_Child > >, T_count >
memberdef.name: DatumArray

detaileddescription.para:
An array of anonymous but identical DatumElements. Can be used anywhere where DatumStruct may used.
T_Child
type to repeat. May be either another sub tree consisting of a nested DatumStruct resp. DatumArray or any other type making it an array of leaves of this type.
T_count
number of repetitions of T_Child

helper function to get the type of a DatumElement node
T_DatumElement
DatumElement to get the type of
type of the element

helper function to get the UID of a DatumElement node
T_DatumElement
DatumElement to get the UID of
UID of the element

memberdef.type: llama::Factory< llama::mapping::One< UserDomain< dimension >, DatumDomain >, llama::allocator::Stack< SizeOf< DatumDomain >::value > >
memberdef.definition: using llama::OneOnStackFactory = llama::Factory< llama::mapping::One< UserDomain< dimension >, DatumDomain >, llama::allocator::Stack< SizeOf<DatumDomain>::value > >
memberdef.name: OneOnStackFactory

detaileddescription.para:
Special factory which predefines some options for getting a View with only one element laying on the stack avoiding costly allocation operations.
dimension
dimension of the view
DatumDomain
the datum domain for the one element mapping
tempAlloc

memberdef.type: typename internal::GetCoordFromUIDImpl< T_DatumDomain, DatumCoord< >, 0, void, T_UID... >::type
memberdef.definition: using llama::GetCoordFromUID = typename internal::GetCoordFromUIDImpl< T_DatumDomain, DatumCoord< >, 0, void, T_UID... >::type
memberdef.name: GetCoordFromUID

detaileddescription.para:
Converts a coordinate in a datum domain given as UID to a DatumCoord .
T_DatumDomain
the datum domain (DatumStruct)
T_UID...
the uid of in the datum domain, may also be empty (for DatumCoord< >)
a DatumCoord with the datum domain tree coordinates as template parameters

memberdef.definition: using llama::GetType = typename internal::GetTypeImpl< T_DatumDomain, T_datumDomainCoords... >::type
memberdef.name: GetType

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the type of a node in a datum domain tree for a coordinate given as tree index (like for DatumCoord)
T_DatumDomain
the datum domain (probably DatumStruct)
T_datumDomainCoords...
the coordinate
type at the specified node

memberdef.definition: using llama::GetTypeFromDatumCoord = typename internal::GetTypeFromDatumCoordImpl< T_DatumDomain, T_DatumCoord >::type
memberdef.name: GetTypeFromDatumCoord

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the type of a node in a datum domain tree for a coordinate given as DatumCoord
T_DatumDomain
the datum domain (probably DatumStruct)
T_DatumCoord
the coordinate
type at the specified node

memberdef.type: typename internal::GetUIDfromDatumCoord< DatumElement< NoName, T_DatumDomain >, T_DatumCoord >::type
memberdef.definition: using llama::GetUID = typename internal::GetUIDfromDatumCoord< DatumElement< NoName, T_DatumDomain >, T_DatumCoord >::type
memberdef.name: GetUID

detaileddescription.para:
return the unique identifier of the DatumElement at a DatumCoord inside the datum domain tree.
T_DatumDomain
the datum domain, probably of type DatumStruct or DatumArray
T_DatumCoord
the datum coord, probably of type DatumCoord
unique identifer type

Gives the type of an IntegerSequence with ascending elements, e.g. MakeIntegerSequence< 4 > = IntegerSequence< 0, 1, 2, 3 >.
T_N
number of integers in the sequence
an IntegerSequence type

Gives the type of an IntegerSequence of zeros, e.g. MakeIntegerSequence< 4 > = IntegerSequence< 0, 0, 0, 0 >.
T_N
number of integers in the sequence
an IntegerSequence type

memberdef.definition: using llama::GetTupleType = typename internal::GetTupleTypeImpl< T_Tuple, T_pos >::type
memberdef.name: GetTupleType

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the type of an element in a tuple
T_Tuple
tuple type
T_pos
position of the element
the type

memberdef.definition: using llama::TupleCatType = typename internal::TupleCatTypeImpl< T_Tuple1, T_Tuple2 >::type
memberdef.name: TupleCatType

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the tuple type of the concatenation of two tuples
T_Tuple1
type of the first tuple
T_Tuple2
type of the second tuple

The run-time specified user domain
T_dim
compile time dimensionality of the user domain

A list of DatumElement which may be used to define a datum domain.
T_Leaves...
List of DatumElement

Datum domain tree node which may either a leaf or refer to a child tree presented as another DatumStruct.
T_Identifier
Name of the node. May be any type (struct, class). llama::NoName is considered a special identifier, which never matches.
T_Type
Type of the node. May be either another sub tree consisting of a nested DatumStruct or any other type making it a leaf of this type.

Uses the OneOnStackFactory to allocate one (probably temporary) element for a given dimension and dautm domain on the stack (no costly allocation).
dimension
dimension of the view
DatumDomain
the datum domain for the one element mapping
the allocated view
OneOnStackFactory

Create a tuple for a given list of elements, which are added. Has the advantage that the tuple type doesn't need to be written down, but can be concluded from the function parameters, e.g. auto myTuple = makeTuple( 23, 13.37, std::size_t(42) ) instaed of the error-prone Tuple< int, double, std::size_t > myTuple( 23, 13.37, std::size_t(42) ).
T_Elements...
Types for the tuple. Will probably concluded from the function call parameters (template argument deduction).
elements
elements to have in the returned tuple
the created tuple

Returns an element in a tuple
T_pos
position of the element
T_Tuple
tuple type, probably indirectly given with template argument deduction
tuple
the tuple to get the element of
a copy of the element

Returns a const reference to an element in a tuple
T_pos
position of the element
T_Tuple
tuple type, probably indirectly given with template argument deduction
tuple
the tuple to get the element of
a const reference to the element

memberdef.argsstring: (T_Tuple1 const t1, T_Tuple2 const t2) -> decltype(internal::TupleCatImpl< T_Tuple1, T_Tuple2 >()(t1, t2))
memberdef.name: tupleCat

detaileddescription.para:
Concatenates two tuples to a new tuple containing the elements of both.
T_Tuple1
type of the first tuple, probably indirectly given as template argument deduction
T_Tuple2
type of the second tuple, probably indirectly given as template argument deduction
t1
first tuple
t2
second tuple
new tuple with element of both input tuples

memberdef.argsstring: (T_Tuple const tuple, T_Replacement const replacement) -> decltype(internal::TupleReplaceImpl< T_pos, T_Tuple, T_Replacement >()(tuple, replacement))
memberdef.name: tupleReplace

detaileddescription.para:
Creates a copy of a tuple with one element replaced by another.
T_pos
position of element to change
T_Tuple
type of input tuple
T_Replacement
new type of element at replaced position
tuple
tuple in which an element shall be replaced
replacement
new element for the returned tuple
new tuple with same size but maybe new type and replaced element

memberdef.argsstring: (T_Tuple const tuple, T_Functor const functor) -> decltype(internal::TupleTransform< T_Tuple, T_Functor >()(tuple, functor))
memberdef.name: tupleTransform

detaileddescription.para:
Applies a functor for every element of a tuple and creating a new tuple with the result of the element transformations.
T_Tuple
tuple type
T_Functor
Functor type. The functor needs to implement an operator() with one template parameter and one parameter of this type being the current element, which returns some new element of any type.
tuple
the tuple
functor
the functor
a new tuple of the same size but maybe different type

Returns a new tuple without the very first element. Does only work for tuples with at least one element.
T_Tuple
tuple type
tuple
the tuple
new tuple without first element

Creates a user domain filled with zeros.
T_dim
dimension of the user domain
UserDomain filled with zeros
